With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved.

programme.title: Planet Sex With Cara Delevingne

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: In 2019, `Wagatha Christie' gripped Britain as Coleen Rooney accused Rebekah Vardy of leaking stories about her to the tabloid press. Despite huge media attention on this social media scandal, and a trial that ended up in the high-court in the summer of 2022, with Rooney emerging victorious, the inside story of how and why this extraordinary moment in British culture came to pass, has never fully been told, until now.

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: It's week six, and the candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai. Here they must put on a corporate away day for two international clients based in the city. While one team shows off the glitz and glam of the city, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. But it's the team with the most profit at the end that will win. Back on home soil, it's the end of the road for another candidate.

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
programme.desc: When self-taught mathematical genius Srinivasa Ramanujan fails out of college, he does not give up hope. Determined to pursue his passion, he contacts Professor G H Hardy and is invited to attend Trinity College.

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris Bavin meets a group of extraordinary Bloomers who must start from scratch every year after their gardening efforts are literally washed away. Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire is at the confluence of four rivers, which makes for a lovely setting, but is one that devastates the town to a greater or lesser degree every year when the waters rise and flood the town.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein examine whether a wealthy female tenant was poisoned by her landlord who she signed over her assets to, just before her death in 1911.

programme.title: Earth's Greatest Spectacles
programme.desc: New England is the stage for the most incredible colour change on Earth - when the vivid greens of summer give way to the golds and reds of the fall. This film revels in the full glory of the spectacle, and reveals how this vibrant fiesta is created by the battles between the trees and the forests inhabitants.

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: Spalding Plant and Vegetable Auction in Lincolnshire is the oldest market of its kind in the UK, having started in 1948. There are three sales a week, selling as many as 1,000 bags and boxes of veg, and up to 16,000 plants, shrubs and trees in a day.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: In Blackburn, Anita Manning values a gold charm bracelet, and Philip Serrell takes a shine to an unusual globe. Paul Martin finds about the remarkable life of classical singer Kathleen Ferrier.

programme.desc: Rick returns to Cornwall in the spot where his passion for seafood began, at the exposed rock pools below his parents' old house on the Cornish Atlantic coast. With his freshly foraged mussels, Rick heads home to Padstow.

programme.title: Nadiya's Fast Flavours
programme.desc: Nadiya turns her attention to one of her favourite things, special occasions. She starts with her lemon drizzle swirls. A twist on the cinnamon bun, these fluffy lemon- and cardamom-scented creations are topped with a pillowy citrus frosting.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: The specialist subjects are U2, toy dog breeds, the Mitford Sisters and guest stars in `Friends'.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Six contestants in search of a semi-final place must deal with a series of questions. Find out what connects Hypersensitive immune response, In a manner befitting royalty, and Building for art display.

programme.title: QI

programme.title: Ordinary Love
programme.desc: Joan and Tom have been married for many years. There is an ease to their relationship that only comes from spending a life time together and a depth of love which expresses itself through tenderness and humour in equal part. When Joan is unexpectedly diagnosed with breast cancer, the course of her treatment shines a light on their relationship as they are faced with the challenges that lie ahead and the prospect of what might happen if something were to happen to her.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher is in Cornwall, but he's not here to explore its fabulous 300-mile coastline. Instead, he will be going underground to unearth the legacy of the county's renowned tin and copper mining industries. Sean encounters an endangered mammal that has set up home in disused mine shafts at Prideaux Wood, and at Penwith we delve underground to discover the history and geology of a 500-year-old tin mine that contains some of the deepest seams in the country.

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Facing the Dragons' wrath this time are a Welsh fashion designer with a selection of handbags made from fish skin; an 18-year-old who hopes to make a withdrawal from the bank of Dragons' Den with his personalised bank card business; two neighbours on a mission to save the high street with their shop local app; and the inventor of an alarm system that tackles van crime before the damage has been done.

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Belinda from Northamptonshire and upcyclers Becky and Paul from Oxfordshire are hoping Dom and his team can help them turn their passions into profits. Belinda has only been glass-blowing for three years and has recently graduated from university. Becky and husband Paul met and married after their partners both passed away. Now they want to establish a business that will support the two of them so that Paul can give up his painting and decorating job, and they can work together.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia
programme.desc: With Asia being about half a day ahead of America, when people are getting ready to settle in for the night in the US the day is just starting in places like China and Japan that are important to the global economy. Featuring anchors in both New York and Hong Kong, `Bloomberg Daybreak Asia' features business and financial guests, in addition to providing insights into news and movements in global markets. This instalment of `Daybreak' joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: China Open
programme.desc: The definitive guide to the markets in Hong Kong and on the mainland. Rishaad Salamat, David Ingles, Tom Mackenzie and Yvonne Man bring the latest news and analysis to start the trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Asia
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the `Bloomberg Markets' banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. This Asian-focused version is hosted by Shery Ahn, David Ingles, Haidi Lun, Rishaad Salamat and Angie Lau. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Middle East
programme.desc: Connecting the Asian and European markets by addressing the global issues with a context specific to the Middle East.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: `Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe' joins the network's lineup to deliver viewers information about business and financial news from the region. Manus Cranny and Anna Edwards host the show from London, joined by business professionals and journalists who offer their thoughts on the day's industry happenings. This instalment of `Daybreak' joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Europe
programme.desc: Bloomberg Markets: Europe is a fast-paced hour of news and analysis, building towards the drama and excitement of the start of trading across the continent.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Open
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe open when most Americans are sleeping. Bloomberg covers the start of the European trading day with this show - which airs in the early morning hours in the Eastern time zone - as part of the network's programming block dedicated to covering financial activity overseas. The show, broadcast from London, features discussions of the stories that are expected to impact the European markets that day and, subsequently, other markets around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance: Early Edition
programme.desc: Bringing insight on global markets and the top business stories of the day, from New York and London.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: An examination of business stories, finance news and global reports on markets from London and New York.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: The Open
programme.desc: Showcasing the most insightful and informative Bloomberg charts to help position the global audience for the trading day, accompanied by the Street's biggest and most respected strategists.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Americas
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the `Bloomberg Markets' banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. This American-focused version is hosted by Mark Barton, Scarlet Fu, David Gura and Vonnie Quinn. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Close
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe close when the American markets are still in full swing. Bloomberg covers the end of the European trading day with this half-hour show - which airs in the morning US time, afternoon in Europe - during the network's `Bloomberg Markets' programming block. The show is hosted by two anchors on separate continents - Betty Liu in Bloomberg's New York studio and Mark Barton in London - who discuss the stories that impacted the European markets that day. The show also features sound bites from some of the day's biggest news.

programme.title: Fareed Zakaria GPS
programme.desc: Host, columnist, and best-selling author Fareed Zakaria offers insightful analysis and interviews world leaders, artists, scientists, business leaders, global affairs analysts, and other cultural observers for the `Global Public Square'. Zakaria is also a syndicated columnist for The Washington Post, a contributing editor for The Atlantic magazine, and hosts in-depth, prime-time specials for CNN Worldwide. `Fareed Zakaria GPS' was launched in 2008 and each week's program airs worldwide on CNN, from New York or other locations around the world. The program is characterized by smart debate and discussion on world events and public affairs, designed to help viewers understand the world around them and the newest thinking on the globe's biggest challenges.

programme.title: The Lead With Jake Tapper
programme.desc: CNN's chief Washington correspondent, Jake Tapper, hosts this hour-long weekday afternoon program, which covers all the day's top stories from around the country and the world, headlines that span politics, money, sports and popular culture. `The Lead' works to ensure that viewers are caught up on the stories that matter, often highlighting news that may have been overlooked. Prior to joining CNN, Tapper served as senior White House correspondent at ABC News.

programme.title: World Sport
programme.desc: Highlights and action from the world's sporting competitions.

programme.title: The Situation Room With Wolf Blitzer
programme.desc: Anchor Wolf Blitzer invites CNN correspondents, analysts and guests for timely coverage of the day's news events. Patterned after the concept of the White House Situation Room, the Monday-Saturday show is a discussion forum often with opposing sides debating current national affairs.

programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: It's Erin Burnett's turn to step out front and try to maintain a viable viewer presence for CNN in the weekday news arena. But the former CNBC anchor won't worry about ratings for her hourlong general news program, comparing that burden to "death." Instead, she'll concern herself with translating world events into relevant information for viewers, paying close attention to such topics as the Middle East and women's issues. "I want people to say that our show is smart. I want our show to be authentic", Burnett says in a promo. "I want our show to have courage". Left unsaid, of course, is that she wants her show to have a big audience, too.

programme.title: Anderson Cooper 360
programme.desc: Cooper brings his prickly but often witty perspective to current events and personalities in the news. He is joined by a series of guests that frequently include political and legal analysts.

programme.desc: It's Erin Burnett's turn to step out front and try to maintain a viable viewer presence for CNN in the weekday news arena. But the former CNBC anchor won't worry about ratings for her hourlong general news program, comparing that burden to "death." Instead, she'll concern herself with translating world events into relevant information for viewers, paying close attention to such topics as the Middle East and women's issues. "I want people to say that our show is smart. I want our show to be authentic", Burnett says in a promo. "I want our show to have courage". Left unsaid, of course, is that she wants her show to have a big audience, too.

programme.desc: CNN's chief Washington correspondent, Jake Tapper, hosts this hour-long weekday afternoon program, which covers all the day's top stories from around the country and the world, headlines that span politics, money, sports and popular culture. `The Lead' works to ensure that viewers are caught up on the stories that matter, often highlighting news that may have been overlooked. Prior to joining CNN, Tapper served as senior White House correspondent at ABC News.
